author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Men’s Golf Central: Visit Knoxville Collegiate Tournament Preview - BVM Sports
text: The 6th-ranked Tennessee men’s golf team kicks off its fall season at the Visit Knoxville Collegiate, playing three rounds at the Tennessee National Golf Club. The event features 18 holes each on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, hosted at a challenging Greg Norman-designed course. Tennessee aims to defend its title after winning last year's tournament with a 25-under total. This year's field includes several high-ranking teams, with Tennessee entering as the highest in Golfweek's preseason rankings. - Tennessee won last year's event at 25-under par. - The Vols tied a school record with three tournament titles last season. - The tournament includes top teams like No. 12 Ole Miss and No. 13 Georgia Tech. - Individual players like Lance Simpson and Jackson Herrington have earned preseason All-America honors. The tournament will serve as a key criterion for player performances heading into a competitive season. Strong individual finishes can influence future rankings and team selection for upcoming events.Bottom Line The Visit Knoxville Collegiate presents a pivotal opportunity for Tennessee to showcase its strength as the top-ranked team in the field, reinforcing its momentum from a successful previous season.
